Detailed Description

Objects of this class is used to process a ExpandRouteRequestPacket.

Will create a ExpandRouteReplyPacket with the route. The format depends on the parameters in the request packet.

Definition at line 47 of file ExpandRouteProcessor.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum ExpandRouteProcessor::description_t
 

The differnt types of the route (in text format) that could be returned.

{ { NB!} These types should be moved elsewhere when this is supported in the packet!}.

Enumeration values:
NOVICE_DESCRIPTION  This indicates that all points where anything change (street name, to turn etc.) will be included in the route.
NORMAL_DESCRIPTION  The normal route description.

Should be resonably short, but clearly understandable.

EXPERT_DESCRIPTION  The route description that should be used for the users that usually finds there way.

The route description will be short!

Definition at line 55 of file ExpandRouteProcessor.h.

enum ExpandRouteProcessor::routeformat_t
 

The format of the route.

Enumeration values:
SHORT_ROUTEFORMAT  The shortest name will be printed for the streets that are included in the route descritption.
NORMAL_ROUTEFORMAT  The official name will be printed for the streets that are included in the route descritption.

If this does not excists the alternative namewill be printed or the road number.

LONG_ROUTEFORMAT  All the names of the streets in the route description will be included in the result.

Member Function Documentation

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::addLandmarks (  uint32  prevCountryID,
const map< uint32, uint32 > &  mapIDToCountryID
)  [private]
 

Add landmarks to the route links.

Searches for the key fromNode.toNode in the landmark table of the map, and adds all landmarks that fits to the landmarklist of every route link. The function also checks the bualocation of every route-item to note if a bua is entered or passed.

Parameters:
prevCountryID The country where the previous map of the route (if part of multi-expand) is located. If this is the first part of the route, the countryID is MAX_UINT32. Used for adding new country as landmark.
mapIDToCountryID Table used when routing in overviewMap to find out which country we are in. Holds the mapIDs of the underviewMaps and their country.

byte ExpandRouteProcessor::addStreetCount (  ExpandRouteLink *  turnLink,
ExpandRouteLink *  fromLink,
ExpandRouteLink *  toLink,
bool  usePassedRoadsLM,
bool  noSetting = false
)  [private]
 

Counts the number of possible turns of the same type as a a connection and adds this to the turn count of turnLink.

If usePassedRoadsLM is true the name of the passed street will be returned in passedName.

Parameters:
fromLink The link the route goes from.
toLink The next link in the route
searchedTurn The turn type to check for.
usePassedRoadsLM If true the method returns the name of the road we could have turned to.
Returns:
The turnCount to set in the turnLink

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::findBadGfxCoords (   )  [private]
 

Goes through the ExpandRouteList and identifies the items that have sharp ENTER_ROUNDABOUT or EXIT_ROUNDABOUT turns.

Theese are placed in the AlteredGfxList together with the the information of which coordinates should be disregarded or moved. (Only for Navigator routes.)

void ExpandRouteProcessor::formatName (  const char *  roadName,
char *  formattedName,
LangTypes::language_t  language,
bool  exitNbr = false,
bool  noNumberName = false
)  [private]
 

Format the name by abbreviate it and add "väg" to roadnames only consisting of numbers -> "väg 16".

Note that the adding of "väg" is only performed if swedish is the prefered language.

Parameters:
roadName The roadname to be formatted.
formattedName Output parameter. The formatted roadname, which must be a preallocated buffer with enough size to fit an arbitrary name.

const char* ExpandRouteProcessor::getBestName (  bool  manyNames,
bool  excludeBestName = false
)  [private]
 

Get the "best" name to print.

Parameters:
manyNames If true, several names should be chosen, otherwise just one name.
excludeBestName only if manyNames. The "best" name will not be included among the names.XS
Returns:
Pointer to a buffer containing the "best" name(s). This buffer must NOT be deleted.

const char* ExpandRouteProcessor::getCountryAndBuaName (  StringTable::countryCode  country,
uint32  buaID = MAX_UINT32
)  [private]
 

Get the name of a country, possibly combined with a built-up area (e.g.

"Helsingör, Danmark") that is to be used as a landmark name. The prefered language is used.

Parameters:
country The countryCode of the country to add as landmark.
buaID The itemID of the builtUpArea (if any).
Returns:
The combined name of the country and built-up area. If no buaID is given (default=MAX_UINT32), only the name of the country is returned.

StringTable::stringCode &  sc,
byte  entryCount = 0,

)  [private]
 

Chooses the turndescription for the driving through the specified roundabout.

Parameters:

crossKind The crossingkind of this roundabout.
tran The type of transportation.
driveOnRightSide If driving on right side of the road.
sc Output parameter. The turndescription of driving through the roundabout according to the specified left/right turnnumbers.
Returns:
The turn number (exit count) of passing through the roundabout.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::getStreetCount (  Node *  curNode,
StreetSegmentItem *  curItem,
StreetSegmentItem *  nextItem,
byte &  nbrLeft,

byte &  nbrRbExits,
byte &  nbrRestRbExits,

char *&  rightStreetName,
bool  driveOnRightSide
)  [private]
 

Update the number of street that leads to the right resp.

to the left when passing curNode.

Parameters:

lastItem The previous ssi where we came from.
curItem The current ssi (which consists of curNode)
nbrLeft Outparam. The number of turns to the left.
nbrRight Outparam. The number of turns to the right.
nbrRbExits Outparam. The number of roundabout exits.
nbrRestRbExits Outparam. The number of roundabout exits not allowed to this vehicle.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::getTotals (  uint32 &  totDist,
uint32 &  totTime,
uint32 &  totSST,
bool  firstPacket
)  [private]
 

Computes the total distance, time and standstill time.

Parameters:
totDist Output parameter. Set to the total distance of the route.
totTime Output parameter. Set to the total time of travelling the route, including standstill time.
totSST Output parameter. Set to the total standstill time of travelling the route.
firstPacket Whether the expandroute packet is the first one (ie. includes the start of the route).
Returns:
True if succesful.

void ExpandRouteProcessor::mergeMultiTurns (   )  [private]
 

Change two or more turns separated by one or more small links into one turndescription.

Ex. Turn left 90deg, drive 6m then turn left 90deg becomes a UTURN, Left 90deg drive 7m then turn right 90 deg becomes AHEAD. Ex. Ahead -30 deg + Ahead -30deg + Ahead -30 deg becomes TURN_LEFT. Lower roadClass allows longer distance (7-15m).

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::namePresent (  ExpandRouteLink *  newLink,
uint32  stringCode
)  [private]
 

Method to se if a name (given as a strinCode) is present in the item of a link.

ExpandRouteLink *  oldLink
)  [private]
 

Method to se if the first link has a name that an other link lacks.

Returns:
True if oldLink lacks any of newLinks names.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::newSetTurnNumbersAndRoundabouts (  bool  passedRoadLandMarks  )  [private]
 

Used BEFORE setNamesAndConcatenate() Sets the turnnumbers and passedRoadsof the route links.

No previous turn setting needed.

Parameters:
passedRoadLandMarks Set to true if passed roads should be added as well.
Returns:
True if the method worked.

ExpandRouteReplyPacket* ExpandRouteProcessor::processExpandRouteRequestPacket (  const ExpandRouteRequestPacket *  req,
GenericMap *  theMap
) 
 

Process a given ExpandRouteRequestPacket, respon with a ExpandRouteReplyPacket that contains the expanded route.

{ { NB!} The reply is created inside this method and both the request and the reply { must} be deleted by the caller!}

Parameters:
req A packet containing the route to expand.
theMap The map where the route is located.
Returns:
A ExpandRouteReplyPacket that contains the expanded route.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::sameName (  ExpandRouteLink *  firstLink,
ExpandRouteLink *  secondLink
)  [private]
 

Checks if two RouteLinks have the same name set.

Only checks the choosen name of the links, not if the items share names.

Parameters:

Returns:

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::selectLandmarks (   )  [private]
 

Selects which landmarks that should be included in the final route.

The selection is based on the importance of each landmark in combinatin with how far from the next crossing it is located.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::setNamesAndConcatenate (  bool  firstPacket,
bool  lastPacket,
bool  printAllNames,
bool  removeAheadIfNameDiffer,
bool  navigator,
byte  routeType,
bool  nameChangeAsWaypoint
)  [private]
 

Sets the names of the route links as well as concatenates (removes) links that is not necessary.

Parameters:
firstPacket Whether this is the first packet of the expanding or not (ie. if it contains the start of the route).
printAllNames Whether all names for a certain road segment should be used in the turndescription or not.
removeAheadIfNameDiffer Whether the route description should be included if turndescription is AHEAD and only the name differ.
navigator If the packet comes from a navigator.
noConcat If this is set to true only follow road is concatinated.
nameChangeAsWaypoint For later wayfinders. Will not conc. a name change, but instread change the turndesc to indicator.
Returns:
True if succesful.

Set the possible turns.

The turns that was possible to make, but not made at this place. Run this AFTER setNamesAndConc()

Parameters:
thisItem The Item to set.
prevItem The Item leading to this item.
Returns:

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::setTransportationType (   )  [private]
 

Sets the transportation type (walking/driving) for the route links.

The link containing the node id that signals changes of transportation is removed from the list.

Returns:
True if succesful.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::setTurnNumbersAndRoundabouts (   )  [private]
 

Sets the turnnumbers of the route links ("3:rd street to the left), and the roundabout exit numbers ("2:nd exit of roundabout / right in roundabout").

Returns:
True if succesful.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::storeDataFromConnections (  bool  uTurn,
byte  routeType
)  [private]
 

Extracts and sets data from the connections of the route links.

Sets the turndescriptions, traverse time, crossing kind and the signpost information. True if we are starting with an U-Turn.

Returns:
True if succesful.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::toPrintNewName (  Item *  item  )  [private]
 

Check if to print new name.

If a new name should be printed then this is inserted in the m_possibleNames-Vector.

Parameters:
item The item that we are driving into.
Returns:
True if a new item name should be written, false otherwise.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::updateLandmarks (   )  [private]
 

Performs misc updates of the landmarks in the route list.

E.g. updates pass-location to at-location for landmarks that are tied to ahead-turns (e.g. when ssi change name). Also sorts the landmarklist so that buas will appear in the correct order compared to other landmarks in the description.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::updateLandmarksBeforeSelect (   )  [private]
 

Checks that the location for built-up areas is correct pass/into.

This is done before selecting which landmarks that should be kept in the final route.

void ExpandRouteProcessor::updatePossibleNames (  Item *  item  )  [private]
 

Resets (clears) m_possibleNames and updates it with the names that are present in the specified item.

Parameters:
item The item who's names should be added to the possible name vector.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::updateStartAndEnd (  uint16  startOffset,
bool  ignoreStartOffset,
bool  startTowards0,
uint16  endOffset,
bool  ignoreEndOffset,
bool  endTowards0,
uint32  lastID,
uint32  lastMapID,
bool  uTurn,
byte  routeType
)  [private]
 

Updates the time and distance for the start and end of the route by considering the offset, ie.

how far on a street your start/end-point is. It also recomputes the standstill time based for the start and end based on the standstill time in order to get times that match the ones the RouteModule uses for its calculations. The starting angle is also computed here.

XXX: Also contains the setting of turndescriptions for the start and end links. This should be moved to somewhere else.

Parameters:
startOffset The offset for the start point.
ignoreStartOffset True if startoffset is to be ignored (doesn't start here).
startTowards0 
endOffset The offset for the end point.
ignoreEndOffset True if endoffset is to be ignored (doesn't end here).
endTowards0 
lastID The id of the last item on the previous map of the route (only used when part of an expand).
lastMapID The map id of the previous map of the route (only used when part of an expand).
Returns:
True if succesful.

char* ExpandRouteProcessor::m_currentRoadName [private]
 

Pointer to an preallocated memoryarea that could be used to return the roadname from the getPossibleName-method.

This is mainly used to avoid reallocations and decrease the risk of memoryleaks.

Vector ExpandRouteProcessor::m_possibleNames [private]
 

Vector containing the string index of the possible names right now.

To be able to avoid "ahead to E22; ahead to ESSINGELEDEN; ahead to E22; etc" if there are multiple names.

Definition at line 513 of file ExpandRouteProcessor.h.

bool ExpandRouteProcessor::m_printNamesIfTheyDiffer [private]
 

Indicates if a name should be printed if the names differ from what the names were on the previous link.

This variable is used to avoid a changing of names just because we have crossed a mapborder.
